eyeColors.contentDescription: Your eye color is brown. Brown eyes are cool! Here are some details about brown eyes...
eyeColors.goal: Bring out the richness and versatility of brown eyes.

recommendations.title: Warm Tones
recommendations.description: Gold, bronze, and rich burgundy add warmth and dimension.

recommendations.title: Cool Tones
recommendations.description: Purples like plum and violet create a striking contrast.

recommendations.title: Metallic Tones
recommendations.description: Copper, bronze, and emerald green for bold looks.

recommendations.title: Avoid: Muted browns
recommendations.description: They may blend too much with the natural eye color.

techniques: Create a smokey eye using rich purple or green tones.
Use a metallic gold or bronze shade on the lid with a darker brown in the crease.
For eyeliner, experiment with emerald green or deep purple for a unique touch.

eyeColors.contentDescription: Your eye color is blue. Here are some details about blue eyes...
eyeColors.goal: Enhance the vividness and contrast of blue tones.

recommendations.title: Warm Tones
recommendations.description: Copper, bronze, peach, and terracotta create contrast and make blue eyes pop.

recommendations.title: Neutral Tones
recommendations.description: Soft taupe or beige for a subtle look.

recommendations.title: Cool Tones
recommendations.description: Navy blue or slate grey for a dramatic effect

recommendations.title: Avoid: Bright blues
recommendations.description: They may clash with the natural eye color

techniques: Use a bronze or gold shimmer on the lid with a darker brown shade in the crease.
Highlight the inner corner with champagne or light gold for brightness.
Line the eyes with brown or copper eyeliner to enhance depth.

eyeColors.contentDescription: Your eye color is green. Here are some details about green eyes...
eyeColors.goal: Enhance the rare green hue with complementary shades.

recommendations.title: Warm Tones
recommendations.description: Copper, rust, and warm browns emphasize the green.

recommendations.title: Cool Tones
recommendations.description: Lavender, plum, and mauve add depth and contrast.

recommendations.title: Metallic Tones
recommendations.description: Gold and bronze for an elegant look.

recommendations.title: Avoid
recommendations.description: Greens that closely match your eye color, as they may reduce contrast

techniques: Apply a copper or bronze shade across the lid and blend with a warm brown in the crease.
Use a light gold shimmer in the inner corner and under the brow bone for a lifted effect.
Line the eyes with plum or aubergine eyeliner for a soft, enhancing touch.

eyeColors.contentDescription: Your eye color is grey. Here are some details about grey eyes...
eyeColors.goal: Amplify the soft, mysterious quality of grey eyes.

recommendations.title: Warm Tones
recommendations.description: Peach, pink, and rose gold add warmth and contrast.

recommendations.title: Cool Tones
recommendations.description: Charcoal, navy, and silver for a dramatic effect.

recommendations.title: Metallic Tones
recommendations.description: Silver and gunmetal accentuate the natural coolness of grey.

recommendations.title: Avoid: Overly muted greys
recommendations.description: They may dull the eye color.

techniques: Use a soft peach or rose shade on the lid with a charcoal grey in the outer corner for definition.
Add silver shimmer to the center of the lid for a reflective effect.
Line the eyes with black or dark grey eyeliner to enhance intensity.

faceColors.contentDescription: Your skin color is light nude. Fair skin tones often have cool or neutral undertones that can easily show too much color, so subtlety is key.

recommendations.title: Cool Tones
recommendations.description: Soft pinks, baby pinks, and pastel peach for a delicate flush.

recommendations.title: Warm Tones
recommendations.description: Light coral or soft apricot for a sun-kissed glow.

recommendations.title: Finish
recommendations.description: Opt for sheer or satin finishes for a natural look. Avoid overly pigmented or dark shades, as they can appear harsh.

recommendations.title: TBD
recommendations.description: TBD

faceColors.contentDescription: Your skin color is beige. Beige skin tones often have neutral or slightly warm undertones.
faceColors.goal: Enhance the vividness and contrast of blue tones.

recommendations.title: Cool Tones
recommendations.description: Rosy pinks and mauves add a touch of color without overpowering.

recommendations.title: Warm Tones
recommendations.description: Soft coral, peach, or light terracotta enhance warmth.

recommendations.title: Finish
recommendations.description: Satin or shimmer finishes add dimension to the skin. Avoid overly bright shades that can clash with the neutral undertone.

recommendations.title: TBD
recommendations.description: TBD

faceColors.contentDescription: Your skin color is olive. Olive skin tones have greenish or golden undertones, making earthy shades particularly flattering.
faceColors.goal: Enhance the rare green hue with complementary shades.

recommendations.title: Warm Tones
recommendations.description: Coral, warm peach, or amber add warmth without clashing.

recommendations.title: Cool Tones
recommendations.description: Rosy pinks and berry tones provide a natural flush.

recommendations.title: Finish
recommendations.description: Opt for creamy or luminous finishes for a healthy glow. Bronzy blushes can double as a contour for olive tones.

recommendations.title: Avoid
recommendations.description: Avoid very light or pastel shades, which may appear ashy.

faceColors.contentDescription: Your skin color is tanned. Tanned and brown skin tones often have warm or golden undertones that suit vibrant and bold shades.

recommendations.title: Warm Tones
recommendations.description: Bright coral, deep peach, and orange-toned blushes enhance the golden undertones.

recommendations.title: Cool Tones
recommendations.description: Rich berry and plum shades provide a dramatic flush.

recommendations.title: Finish
recommendations.description: Luminous and shimmer finishes complement the warmth of the skin tone. Buildable formulas allow control over intensity.

recommendations.title: Avoid
recommendations.description: Avoid overly light or muted shades, as they may appear chalky.

faceColors.contentDescription: Your skin color is dark. Dark skin tones can carry bold and rich colors beautifully
faceColors.goal: Amplify the soft, mysterious quality of grey eyes.

recommendations.title: Warm Tones
recommendations.description: Deep orange, terracotta, and brick red for a natural warmth.

recommendations.title: Cool Tones
recommendations.description: Rich plum, fuchsia, and wine add a dramatic flush.

recommendations.title: Finish
recommendations.description: Opt for creamy or satin finishes to add dimension. Shimmer blushes enhance the glow on darker skin tones.

recommendations.title: Avoid
recommendations.description: Avoid pastel or very light shades, which can appear ashy.

eyeShapes.contentDescription: Your eye shape is almond. Almond eyes are oval-shaped with a slight upward lift at the outer corners, often considered the most balanced shape.

recommendations.title: Eyeshadow
recommendations.description:
Apply a medium-tone shade across the lid and a darker shade in the outer corner and crease to define the natural shape.
Blend upward and outward to emphasize the elongated shape.

recommendations.title: Eyeliner
recommendations.description:
Use a winged liner to accentuate the natural lift at the outer corner.
Tightline the upper lash line for added definition without closing off the eye.

recommendations.title: Mascara
recommendations.description: Focus on the outer lashes to emphasize the elongated shape.

recommendations.title: Pro Tip
recommendations.description: Experiment with cat-eye styles, as almond eyes carry them beautifully.

eyeShapes.contentDescription: Your eye shape is round. Round eyes are large and often have a more prominent curve, with a visible crease.

recommendations.title: Eyeshadow
recommendations.description:
Use darker shades on the outer corners to elongate the eyes and create a more almond-like appearance.
Avoid placing too much shimmer or light color on the center of the lid, which can emphasize roundness.

recommendations.title: Eyeliner
recommendations.description:
Apply liner along the upper lash line and extend it outward slightly for a subtle wing.
Avoid heavy liner on the lower lash line, as it can make the eyes appear smaller.

recommendations.title: Mascara
recommendations.description: Focus on the outer lashes and consider using corner false lashes for added elongation.

recommendations.title: Pro Tip
recommendations.description: Use matte shades in the crease to add depth and minimize roundness.

eyeShapes.contentDescription: Your eye shape is upturned. The outer corners of upturned eyes are higher than the inner corners, creating a lifted appearance.

recommendations.title: Eyeshadow
recommendations.description:
Apply a medium or dark shade to the outer third of the lower lash line to balance the upward tilt.
Use lighter shades on the lid and blend outward.

recommendations.title: Eyeliner
recommendations.description:
Line the upper lash line with a soft wing.
Apply a thin line on the lower lash line, focusing on the outer half to ground the shape.

recommendations.title: Mascara
recommendations.description: Emphasize both the upper and lower lashes to highlight symmetry.

recommendations.title: Pro Tip
recommendations.description: Create a balanced look by softening the upward tilt with darker shadows on the lower lash line.

eyeShapes.contentDescription: Your eye shape is downturned. The outer corners of downturned eyes are lower than the inner corners, giving a gentle, droopy effect.

recommendations.title: Eyeshadow
recommendations.description:
Focus darker shades on the upper outer corner to lift the eyes visually.
Avoid applying too much product to the lower lash line, as it can accentuate the downturned effect.

recommendations.title: Eyeliner
recommendations.description:
Create a slight upward wing to counteract the downward tilt.
Tightline the upper waterline to add subtle definition and lift.

recommendations.title: Mascara
recommendations.description: Concentrate on the upper lashes and the outer corners for a lifted effect.

recommendations.title: Pro Tip
recommendations.description: Use a highlighter in the inner corner and under the brow bone to brighten the eyes.

faceShapes.contentDescription: Your face shape is oval. Here some details... You will get some tips for usage of blush based on your face shape.
faceShapes.goal: Enhance the natural balance and symmetry of the face.

recommendations.title: Application Step 1
recommendations.description: Identify the apples of your cheeks (the fleshy part that becomes prominent when you smile).

recommendations.title: Application Step 2
recommendations.description: Apply blush lightly to the apples of the cheeks and blend it upward toward the temples.

recommendations.title: Application Step 3
recommendations.description: Use soft, sweeping motions to avoid harsh lines and maintain the natural contours of the oval shape.

recommendations.title: Tip
recommendations.description: Focus on blending for a natural flush. Avoid placing the blush too high or low to maintain proportionality.

faceShapes.contentDescription: Your face shape is round. Here some details... You will get some tips for usage of blush based on your face shape.
faceShapes.goal: Create the illusion of length and define the cheekbones to add structure.

recommendations.title: Application Step 1
recommendations.description: Begin applying blush slightly above the apples of the cheeks to avoid emphasizing roundness.

recommendations.title: Application Step 2
recommendations.description: Sweep the blush upward toward the ears or along the cheekbones to create an elongated effect.

recommendations.title: Application Step 3
recommendations.description: Avoid concentrating blush directly on the fullest part of the cheeks, as this may enhance roundness.

recommendations.title: Tip
recommendations.description: Use an angled brush for precise placement and to mimic the contouring effect.

faceShapes.contentDescription: Your face shape is square. Here some details... You will get some tips for usage of blush based on your face shape.
faceShapes.goal: Soften the angular jawline and add a natural glow to balance the face.

recommendations.title: Application Step 1
recommendations.description: Focus on applying blush on the apples of the cheeks.

recommendations.title: Application Step 2
recommendations.description: Blend the blush in a circular motion toward the temples, softening any sharp angles.

recommendations.title: Application Step 3
recommendations.description: A subtle horizontal application can help reduce the prominence of strong facial lines..

recommendations.title: Tip
recommendations.description: Choose warm, natural tones to add softness and complement the angular structure.
